subject: RE: [junit] initializing log4j via junit
msgSnippet: ... Unless you re using Jakarta Commons Logging, which is a wrapper to log4j.  If it can t find the log4j.jar file, then it uses some other less-good ways of
messageBody:
> If a required jar isn't on the classpath, wouldn't there be
> an exception?

Unless you're using Jakarta Commons Logging, which is a
wrapper to log4j. If it can't find the log4j.jar file,
then it uses some other less-good ways of logging. Or
so I've heard.

> I would go with the suspicion that it's a classpath thing.
> The classpath for the junit task - have you used the verbose
> switch of ant to check that it does contain the location of
> the log4j.properties file?

I agree 100% with that suggestion!


Todd.
